title: Live updates: After taking two key cities, Syrian rebels set their sights on Homs
content: After Hayat Tahrir al-Sham gained control of Hama, rebels are seeking to take Homs, as they continue their breakneck advance across Syria.
summary: After Hayat Tahrir al-Sham gained control of Hama, rebels are seeking to take Homs, as they continue their breakneck advance across Syria.

title: Who is Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, the Islamist rebel leading the Syrian advance?
Romanian court annuls presidential vote after Russian interference claims
content: Calin Georgescu won the first round of the election after being propelled by TikTok. Romania’s security services pointed to “Russian hybrid actions.”
summary: Calin Georgescu won the first round of the election after being propelled by TikTok. Romania’s security services pointed to “Russian hybrid actions.”

title: Who is Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, the Islamist rebel leading the Syrian advance?
content: The 42-year-old Syrian was once a shadowy figure leading an al-Qaeda offshoot. Now he’s stepping into the spotlight.

title: Health officials grapple with deadly mystery ‘Disease X’ in Congo
content: The mysterious flu-like disease has killed dozens in the central African country of the Democratic Republic of Congo, mostly women and children, officials said.
summary: The mysterious flu-like disease has killed dozens in the central African country of the Democratic Republic of Congo, mostly women and children, officials said.

title: Rebel advance in Syria threatens to unravel Putin’s previous triumph
content: The successful intervention on behalf of Syrian President Assad almost 10 years ago underscored Putin’s assertion that Russia was still a global power.

title: As lawmakers move to impeach South Korean President Yoon, what happens next?

content: The French president said he would name a new prime minister in days, as he scolded the far-right and left factions that toppled the government in a no-confidence vote.

title: A surprising turn in Syria's civil war
content: In the past week, the civil war in Syria reignited. Islamist rebels seized control of Aleppo, triggering a new phase in a years-long civil war. The Post’s Middle East bureau chief, Kareem Fahim, talks with host Elahe Izadi about why this moment matters.
summary: In the past week, the civil war in Syria reignited. Islamist rebels seized control of Aleppo, triggering a new phase in a years-long civil war. The Post’s Middle East bureau chief, Kareem Fahim, talks with host Elahe Izadi about why this moment matters.

title: French government collapsed after no-confidence vote. What happens now?
content: President Emmanuel Macron must seek a new prime minister after Michel Barnier’s administration became the shortest-serving in the modern French republic.
summary: President Emmanuel Macron must seek a new prime minister after Michel Barnier’s administration became the shortest-serving in the modern French republic.

title: Iran is sending regional fighters to Syria. Can they save Assad again?
content: Fighters from Hezbollah and Iraq’s Shiite militias have deployed to Syria to support government forces, but it’s unclear if they are capable of turning the tide.
summary: Fighters from Hezbollah and Iraq’s Shiite militias have deployed to Syria to support government forces, but it’s unclear if they are capable of turning the tide.

title: Battles rage around Syria’s Hama as airstrikes hit hospitals, journalists
content: A group of Syrian journalists headed toward Hama were hit by an airstrike, killing photographer Anas Alkharboutli.

title: South Korea’s martial law crisis stirs memories of 1980 Gwangju massacre
content: In the uncertain hours early Wednesday, many recalled the nation’s last martial law, which came after a coup installed a military dictator and triggered a deadly uprising.
summary: In the uncertain hours early Wednesday, many recalled the nation’s last martial law, which came after a coup installed a military dictator and triggered a deadly uprising.
